author: pburba
msg: On the subtree-mergeinfo branch: Don't set non-inheritable mergeinfo unless
it is really necessary.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(do_directory_merge): Don't set non-inheritable mergeinfo to describe an
inoperative merge.

author: pburba
msg: On the subtree-mergeinfo branch: Revert r36853 from merge.c.
r36853 stated: "If a subtree has no explicit mergeinfo prior to the merge
and also has missing children, then we need to record non-inheritable
mergeinfo on that subtree.  Otherwise those missing children may start
inheriting bogus mergeinfo."
The thing is: So what?!  Implicit in this change was the idea that we
couldn't be sure if the merge would effect the missing subtree's children if
they were present, but actually we can be sure.
The child of a subtree could be considered missing for a number of reasons,
it might be switched, the working copy could be shallow, or it might be
absent to authz restrictions.  But in every case we know that the merge
would have affected the missing subtree because we see a skip notification
or a tree conflict.  Even edge cases like not having authorization to a
subtree in the source, produce a skip notification -- AFAICT we always
*know*.  So if we don't see a skip notification or a tree conflict then
there was nothing to be merged to the subtree in question even if it was
present.  Yes the subtree will now inherit its mergeinfo from some parent
path where we earlier recorded mergeinfo describing the merge.  Again, so
what?  It will be inheriting whatever it inherited prior to the merge
plus some inoperative mergeinfo, but that is perfectly ok, in fact we do it
every time we record mergeinfo only on the merge target.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(do_directory_merge): Don't record mergeinfo mergeinfo on subtrees with
missing children unless we know that subtree was touched or would have
been touched if it was complete.

author: hwright
msg: * notes/wc-ng-design:
Add some preliminary notes about what it's going to take to upgrade old
working copies.

author: hwright
msg: Further change the expected output for revert tests 17 for wc-ng.
The original test was written as a response to issue 2804, but it turns out
that the series of events in the test creates ambiguities.  Is the revert a
revert of the merge, or a revert of the copy, or the parent or what?  This
basically represents a deviation from known reality, so we define it as Unreal.
Note that the issue solution is still valid, it's the intermediate steps
getting there which require modification.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/revert_tests.py
(status_of_missing_dir_after_revert_replace_with_history_dir): Change an
expectation with wc-ng.

author: pburba
msg: On the subtree-mergeinfo branch: Fix a comment typo.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(subtree_touched_by_merge): Fix a comment typo.
